title: Scientific Conference on the Shroud of Turin
post: I’m doing my best to get the IEEE to withdraw its support for this conference. I filed an ethics complaint against Bruno Barberis and others with the Ethics and Members Conduct Committee of the IEEE. This complaint is basically the same as the complaint I filed against Cardinal Dolan for suppressing my slideshow/lecture with the Congregation for the Doctrine of the Faith. If the IEEE sanctions Barberis, it will in effect be criticizing the Catholic Church for promoting the authenticity of the Holy Shroud.
author: David Roemer

title: Scientific Conference on the Shroud of Turin
post:
“So far, some elements seem to be clear: the scientific results have let say with certainty that the image was produced through a natural process that involved the body of a human being.”
The imaged was produced through a natural process with CERTAINTY?  I beg to differ.  I don’t think so.
author: David O.

title: Scientific Conference on the Shroud of Turin
post: I think you are confusing faith with reason. “Certainty” has to do with reason, not faith. Also, your reference to “natural process” makes no sense to me. All processes are natural. There is no such thing as a “supernatural process.” If you think the Shroud is authentic, you should keep it to yourself. Saying the Shroud is authentic is like saying God caused the Big Bang. There is no evidence God caused the Big Bang.

In my Engineering Geology classes of several decades ago, earthquakes and volcanoes were classified as ‘Accidents’ and ‘Interruptions’, as they interrupted the more usual geomorphic cycle, ref “Geomorphology” by C A Cotton, and apparently originally so termed by a geologist pioneer Davis.  
However we know they are caused by the ‘natural’ movement of the global tectonic plates originating from the convection currents of the earth’s internal magma.  So a “natural process”.

title: Scientific Conference on the Shroud of Turin
post:
When complete fissioned, 1 kg of U235 releases thermal energy corresponding to an explosion of 17,000 tons of TNT.  The bomb at Hiroshima was equivalent to 15,000 tons of TNT, that at Nagasaki 21,000 tons of TNT. 
A conversion of 175 pounds is equivalent to about 80 kg, and would correspond to 1.35 million tons of TNT.  Reverting to the Einstein equation in MKS units that is 7.14 Exa-Joules or 7.14 x 10^18 Joules = 7.14 quintillion Joules.  E = Mc^2 is not the solution to the Resurrection problem!
